Key Match Events: Luke Weaver closed the game with a four-out save in his first playoff appearance.
Clay Holmes got five outs in the middle innings without allowing a run.
Gerrit Cole was replaced after five-plus innings.
Anthony Volpe's throwing error put runners on second and third with one out.
Tim Hill gave up a two-run single to pinch hitter Garrett Hampson.
Holmes got Maikel Garcia to line out to center and Bobby Witt Jr. to ground to third to end the sixth inning.
Austin Wells hit an RBI single to tie the game.
Alex Verdugo's run-scoring base hit gave the Yankees the lead in the seventh inning.
Weaver retired the top of the Kansas City lineup in order to finish off the win.
Pre-Game Insights: General manager Brian Cashman acquired Mark Leiter Jr. and Enyel De Los Santos to give Aaron Boone more choices for late-game action.
Cashman did not view Clay Holmes as a problem despite his struggles.
Post-Match Reflections: Clay Holmes expressed that what Luke Weaver is doing has been a huge boost for the team.
Aaron Boone praised Weaver's performance, especially for his first time in the playoffs.
